poem:
**Net Zero**

The morning paper flutters in my hand,  
each page a breeze that stirs the air.  
I read of warming oceans,  
ticking clocks, the clash of bias and evidence.  
They speak of zero, a number with the weight  
of the world wrapped in its lonely circle.  
And I think how hope is the lightest part  
of any equation.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Britain giving up on net zero is not an option | Letters Andrew Bowie does not seem to understand the difference between evidence and opinion (Tory energy spokesman claims UN climate experts are ‘biased’, 14 May). The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change’s “bias” is in favour of rigorously tested and reviewed scientific evidence built up over decades. That evidence shows that we must reach net zero by 2050 to keep warming to less than 2C,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
